Comment: The type of SQL database server; can be MariaDB, MySQL, SQLite and MSSQL
The host name or IP (for SQLite this is the path to the file)
The server DSN (normally used with MSSQL)
The username
The password
The database's name
The events table name
The name of the column containing the patients' unique IDs
The name of the column containing the prescription dates
The name of the column containing the dosage
The name of the column containing the medication type (can be NA)
The name of the column containing the duration (can be NA)
The table specifying what to do (the actions)
The unique id of the action
The name of the column containing the actions to be done ("CMA7" or "plot.CMA0"); "plot." automatically estimates the CMA (except for CMA0)
The name of the column containing the parameters (e.g., the start of the observation window, hiding the legend...)
The table specifying the classes the medication
The unique id of the class
The name of the column containing the (logical expression defining the) class of medications (e.g., "[medA]" or "[medA] & [medB]"; the medication names are between [])
The table specifying what to do to whom
The numeric primary key uniquely identifying one such processing
The name of the column containing the patients' unique IDs
The name of the column containing the (logical expression of) categories
The name of the column containing the processing to be done ("CMA7" or "plot.CMA0"); "plot." automatically estimates the CMA (except ofr CMA0)
The name of the column containing the parameters (e.g., the start of the observation window)
The table that will contain the results
The numeric primary key uniquely identifying one such result
The reference to the primary key in prtable
The name of the column containing the estimate(s) of the CMA
The name of the column containing type of the CMA estimate (e.g., "simple" or "sliding windows")
The name of the column containing actual JPEG plot as a BLOB
The name of the column containing actual HTML/SVG plot as a BLOB
The default processing and plotting to apply (if more, separated by ";") with any parametters given in paranetheses
The table that will contain the sliding window results
The reference to the primary key in results to which these rows correspond
The name of the column containing the patients' unique IDs
The name of the column containing the windows's unique IDs
The name of the column containing the windows's start date
The name of the column containing the windows's end date
The name of the column containing the windows's estimated CMA
The table that will contain the per episode results
The reference to the primary key in results to which these rows correspond
The name of the column containing the patients' unique IDs
The name of the column containing the episode's unique IDs
The name of the column containing the episode's start date
The name of the column containing the gap days
The name of the column containing the episode's duration
The name of the column containing the episode's end date
The name of the column containing the episode's estimated CMA
